definition: to become
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: The weather became so bad that they had to turn back.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很坏，他们只好原路而归了。

sentences.english: It delivers value more slowly to everyone. Invariably.
sentences.chinese: 这会让交付价值变得更慢，对所有客户都会变慢。

sentences.english: Entire malls will become ghost towns.
sentences.chinese: 所有的大型商场都将变得门可罗雀。

sentences.english: They become too attached to the computer screen. It isn't healthy.
sentences.chinese: 他们变得太黏在计算机屏幕前，这很不健康。

sentences.english: They promised her she would soon be rich beyond her wildest dreams.
sentences.chinese: 他们向她保证很快她就会变得超乎想像的富有。

sentences.english: He says the new facility may make future tests more realistic.
sentences.chinese: 他说，新的设施可能使未来的测试变得更现实。

sentences.english: You feel you have something more to live for.
sentences.chinese: 你感觉生活变得更有意义和丰富多彩。

sentences.english: The libtard morons got change but for the worse.
sentences.chinese: 自由主义白痴们改变了，但却变得更糟。

sentences.english: After that the struggle inside the party grew more acute.
sentences.chinese: 在那以后，党内的斗争变得更加尖锐。

sentences.english: And what other ways can we make our real world more like these fantasy worlds?
sentences.chinese: 我们又能怎样把现实世界变得像那梦中的国度呢？

sentences.english: The feedback will become so strong it destroys the wormhole.
sentences.chinese: 反馈变得很强大而毁坏了虫洞。

sentences.english: Her shriek was dulled by the loud crash of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声在震耳的雷声中变得低沉了。

sentences.english: The tools of media will become more easy to use and more affordable.
sentences.chinese: 媒体工具会变得更加容易操作，更加便宜。

sentences.english: And when it was made plain who Kino was, the doctor grew stern and judicious at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 弄清楚谁是吉纳后，医生变得严肃认真而又明智起来。

sentences.english: This eclipse will be difficult for a number of reasons.
sentences.chinese: 因为几个原因，这个月蚀将变得有些困难。

sentences.english: That has since calmed down and the markets have gotten even quieter lately.
sentences.chinese: 此后市场逐渐平静下来，最近已变得更为平静了。

definition: more (than sth else)/even more
more and more
to seem/to look/to appear
increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
all the more/even more/further
all the more/increasingly
to change into/to turn into/to become
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
usable/workable/feasible/doable/to make/to cause
even more
more/even more/further/still/still more
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
(adverb of degree)/quite/very/awfully
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to tend towards
